channel.title: Jquery on Alex Bachuk
channel.description: Recent content in Jquery on Alex Bachuk

item.title: jQueryTO in Toronto Canada.
item.description: This was my first web development conference that’s not WordCamp. I started developing with JavaScript quite recently, before that I was using jQuery to manipulate DOM and use others plugins (which works for small websites pretty well). Since it was not that far from New York City - I decided to attend and see what’s new in jQuery world (especially after I saw Paul Irish and Addy Osmani among other speakers).

item.title: jQuery Mobile basics
item.description: jQuery Mobile is touch friendly and AJAX powered framework which was built by jQuery team. It is a great framework for building mobile websites or apps and if combine it with responsive design - it becomes even better. Nowadays everyone knows that the best way to build a website is responsive way, a “write once, run everywhere” style. jQuery mobile uses AJAX for page loading and provides flexible theming tool - theme roller, default theme is very iOS-like, but it’s very easy to change just changing default CSS.
